Package co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1

Class StorefrontClientV1.MenuClientV1

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cookies.sdk.services.BaseService<co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.MenuV1Client>
      • co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.StorefrontClientV1.MenuClientV1
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceClient<co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.MenuV1Client>, Storefront.MenuClient, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Enclosing class:
    StorefrontClientV1
    @Immutable
@ThreadSafe
public static final class StorefrontClientV1.MenuClientV1
extends BaseService<co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.MenuV1Client>
implements Storefront.MenuClient
    API client implementing access to the Storefront Menu Service, version 1; the menu service is responsible for rendering final-goods data into abstract product-level menus in different contexts, and is typically consumed by storefront UI implementations.

    The Storefront API, and by extension this Menu API, is a private API service enabling Cookies and close partners to transact online with consumers and businesses. Access to this API requires an bearer token (referred to as an API key) issued by Tech@Cookies.

      static StorefrontClientV1.MenuClientV1 defaults()
      Create an instance of the Menu Client backed entirely with defaults, including a default executor (started with 3 threads at the time of writing), a default header provider applying any API key and authorization settings, an instantiating gRPC transport, and a default empty credential provider.

      Return this service's initialized executor service, which typically just proxies to the executor provider mounted on the client facade.

      Create an instance of the Menu Client backed directly with the provided stub (this is generally useful for testing and in-process or inter-process dispatch).

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        @Nonnull
public static StorefrontClientV1.MenuClientV1 configure​(@Nonnull
                                                        SDKConfiguration configuration)
        Configure an instance of the Menu Client facade using the provided SDK configuration suite, including any specified custom endpoint, executor provider, header provider, credential provider, and transport channel provider.

        When using this interface instead of the builder methods exposed via CookiesSDK.builder(), the developer is required to manage all service state manually. Please see the docs for CookiesSDK for more information about how to acquire a Menu API client easily.

        Parameters:
        configuration - Configuration to use when creating the new facade.
        Returns:
        Instance of the Menu API client facade.

      • defaults

        @Nonnull
public static StorefrontClientV1.MenuClientV1 defaults()
        Create an instance of the Menu Client backed entirely with defaults, including a default executor (started with 3 threads at the time of writing), a default header provider applying any API key and authorization settings, an instantiating gRPC transport, and a default empty credential provider.
        Returns:
        Menu client facade.

        @Nonnull
public static StorefrontClientV1.MenuClientV1 forStub​(@Nonnull
                                                      co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.stub.MenuV1Stub stub)
        Create an instance of the Menu Client backed directly with the provided stub (this is generally useful for testing and in-process or inter-process dispatch).
        Parameters:
        stub - Service stub to use for the newly-minted client facade.
        Returns:
        Menu client facade.

      • menu

        @Nonnull
public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                  AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.MenuRequest> rpc)
        Description copied from interface: Storefront.MenuClient
        Generate a custom menu request based on a developer-crafted protocol buffer, which considers the specified inventory channels, user location and account ID, content locale, and query settings; this method allows full control of the menu generation engine.

        Simpler invocations exist on this interface which work based on a store key, or a content locale (which uses user location detection features).

        Note: This method operates synchronously. Async variants exist and should generally be preferred unless dispatching from a background thread.

        Specified by:
        menu in interface Storefront.MenuClient
        Parameters:
        rpc - Crafted RPC request payload, which specifies the desired menu, and is wrapped to execute and return asynchronously.
        Returns:
        Rendered menu payload across relevant inventory channels, decorated with global content.
        See Also:
        Sychronous version of this method, for dispatch in a background thread., Convenience method if you just need to set the content locale., Convenience method if you just need to set the content locale and store key.

      • search

        @Nonnull
public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.model.MenuSearchResultset> search​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                                 AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.MenuSearchRequest> rpc)
        Description copied from interface: Storefront.MenuClient
        Asynchronously perform a search across available menu items for a given context, based on arbitrary term input and any facet filters or regular filters applied by the user (or underlying code).

        Search results typically reference items via their CPIDs -- i.e. abstract product groups, which contain variants. When using this method, results are filtered based on live inventory signals.

        Specified by:
        search in interface Storefront.MenuClient
        Parameters:
        rpc - Crafted RPC request payload for a menu search operation which is wrapped to execute synchronously.
        Returns:
        Rendered menu search results, based on the input parameters in the subject RPC request payload.
        See Also:
        Asynchronous variant of this method.
